alert.note: Alert for Florence; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 5:54PM EDT until April 05 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Florence County in northeastern South Carolina... Northern Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 554 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Santee Cooper Regional Airport, or 10 miles south of Manning, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Lake City, Kingstree, Salters, Hebron, Cades, Indiantown, Scranton, Greeleyville, Lake City Community Hospital and Williamsburg Regional Hospital. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina.
